paper.name: Chain-of-Thought Reasoning Without Prompting
paper.prompt:
Create a flowchart diagram showing how Chain-of-Thought reasoning emerges in transformers without explicit prompting.

Include these key elements:
- Input layer: Problem statement
- Hidden layers progression: Show how reasoning patterns emerge
- Attention mechanisms: Highlight how attention focuses on relevant intermediate steps
- Emergent CoT: Demonstrate spontaneous step-by-step reasoning
- Output layer: Final answer with derived reasoning

Use a clean, modern design with blue and purple color scheme. Show the flow from input through transformer layers where reasoning emerges naturally.

diagrams.code:
direction right
// Flowchart Title
title Chain of Thought Emergence in Transformers

// Nodes and Groups
Problem Statement [shape: oval, color: lightblue, icon: file-text]
Embedding Layer [shape: rectangle, color: lightblue]

Transformer Layers [color: lightpurple] {
  Hidden Representation After Layer 1 [shape: rectangle, color: purple]
  Hidden Representation After Layer 2 [shape: rectangle, color: purple]
  Hidden Representation After Layer 3 [shape: rectangle, color: purple]
}

Attention Mechanisms [color: blue, icon: eye] {
  Self Attention across Tokens [shape: rectangle, color: lightblue]
  Focus on Intermediate Steps [shape: rectangle, color: lightblue]
}

Emergent Reasoning Steps [shape: rectangle, color: purple, icon: cpu]
Final Answer with Derived Reasoning [shape: oval, color: lightblue, icon: check-circle]

// Relationships
Problem Statement > Embedding Layer
Embedding Layer > Hidden Representation After Layer 1
Hidden Representation After Layer 1 > Hidden Representation After Layer 2
Hidden Representation After Layer 2 > Hidden Representation After Layer 3



Emergent Reasoning Steps > Final Answer with Derived Reasoning
Hidden Representation After Layer 3 > Attention Mechanisms
Attention Mechanisms > Emergent Reasoning Steps
